class_notes: (Writing Ethnography/Narrative Investigations - An exploration of ethnography as a mode of witness, method of research, and form of storytelling centered on creating narratives about the socio-cultural world. Students will critically assess the genre of ethnography through both classic and recent examples. They will also practice crafting ethnographic narratives as a form of research writing. Special attention will be given to the rhetoric, poetics, and ethics of ethnographic forms.)
course_description: Course topics will vary but always will be focused on writing, rhetorical composition and analysis, or literacy skills. Topics possible include a variety of options such as journalistic writing, non-fiction, debate, argumentation, persuasion, digital writing, among others.
